leadership.title: Team/Software Lead (2023-2024)
leadership.description: As the Team and Software Lead, I directed a team of 6 in the construction of an autonomous underwater glider driven by a buoyancy engine, with a remarkable 5-nautical-mile range. I took charge of authoring preliminary design and research documents, meticulously identifying user and sponsor requirements while employing trade studies to select optimal parts. Leveraging my expertise, I developed a sophisticated robotic system integrating path-planning, obstacle avoidance, data collection, and storage functionalities using a Raspberry Pi. Furthermore, I implemented an inertial navigation system enhanced with integrated proximity sensors and machine learning algorithms to significantly enhance navigation accuracy.

leadership.title: President (2023)
leadership.description: As president, I orchestrated numerous successful recruitment events, leading to record high increases in membership. Through collaborative efforts with Honors College faculty and volunteers, I was able to create college wide events to attract members and build connections with new students. Additionally, I led a merchandise drive, generating significant revenue through dues and merchandise sales. In the fall semester, I prioritized creating a dedicated space for freshmen within the honors community, fostering networking opportunities and mentorship. Steering a team of 15 officers and 40 committee members, I provided strategic guidance to ensure the attainment of collective goals and objectives.
leadership.prevTitle: Previous Title: Director of Academic Affairs (2022)

leadership.title: Team Leader (2023)
leadership.description: In the role of Team Leader, I spearheaded a group of 15+ Burnett Honors scholars, offering mentorship and networking opportunities to support their personal, academic, and professional growth. Through weekly discussions and activities, I fostered skill development in problem-solving, leadership, professionalism, and work-life balance. Additionally, I organized events aimed at fostering community engagement and introduced members to over 10 campus organizations, societies, and resources. Moreover, I established and maintained connections with more than 15 industry professionals across various fields, providing valuable networking opportunities for students.

leadership.title: Mentor (2023-2024)
leadership.description: As a mentor, I provided tailored guidance to seven freshman engineering students, equipping them with essential skills and strategies for navigating internship fairs and industry networking. I emphasized the effective utilization of extracurricular activities to enhance internship prospects and conducted thorough resume reviews and elevator pitch practice sessions to bolster their presentation skills. Collaborating closely with a team of 31 mentors, we ensured that all mentees received comprehensive support and constructive feedback from diverse sources, fostering their professional growth and development.

leadership.title: Acting President (2022-2023)
leadership.description: As Acting President, I took charge of organizing the District 5 Conference, overseeing registration, tours, and meals for 50+ delegates and advisors. I implemented protocols to efficiently communicate officer board decisions to our extensive membership of 150+. Additionally, I successfully led the initiation of 52 individuals into our organization, including 39 undergraduate students, 12 graduate students, and 1 eminent engineer. Acting as a key liaison between TBP HQ, UCF, and our FLD chapter, I ensured smooth communication channels through emails, forms, and other documentation.

leadership.title: Student Member (2022-2023)
leadership.description: As a Student Committee Representative, I served as a liaison between the student body and a committee comprised of 15 faculty members, actively contributing input to shape the curriculum and awards program. I played a crucial role in reviewing and approving proposed honors interdisciplinary seminars, offering constructive feedback to enhance their development. Utilizing strong communication skills, I fostered effective collaboration with faculty members, providing a valuable student perspective that enriched decision-making processes.

leadership.title: President (2021-2022)
leadership.description: As president, I prioritized cultivating a cohesive and supportive community within the organization by facilitating interactions between officers and members. Serving as a founding officer, I established robust procedures and protocols for both internal operations and external facility engagements. Overseeing the planning and execution of more than 50 range day and club events, I ensured members had ample opportunities for individual coaching and skill development. Additionally, I spearheaded the creation of a user-friendly website using C# and HTML in an MVC pattern, centralizing club information and streamlining the signup process for enhanced accessibility and engagement.
